definition: to spare no effort (idiom); to do one's utmost
to use up/to exhaust/to end/to finish/to the utmost/exhausted/finished/to the limit (of sth)/all/entirely

sentences.english: We will be dedicated for you to develop new markets, achieve a win-win situation.
sentences.chinese: 我們會盡心竭力爲你們開拓市場，實現雙贏。

sentences.english: So earnest an effort was well deserving of a better reward.
sentences.chinese: 盡心竭力，照理應該得到較好的結果。

sentences.english: The authorities say they are working hard to protect the temples.
sentences.chinese: 當局表示，他們盡心竭力來保護這些廟宇。

definition: fig. people who cannot afford to buy their own house
(of friends or partners) to share both the honor and the disgrace (idiom)
open the net on one side (idiom); let the caged bird fly/to give one's opponent a way out/lenient treatment
(jocularly) public building that has been lying idle (and is thus ideal for housing mosquitos) (Tw)
principle of people's livelihood, the third of Dr Sun Yat-sen's 孫中山|孙中山 Three Principles of the People 三民主義|三民主义 (at the time, meaning redistribution of wealth, self-sufficiency and internal trade)
to be reluctant to give up a post
to regard it as an honor (idiom)
